overview:
The leader of business and hardware development at Mavizon, Madison has six years of tech and business development experience.

While still in college at the University of Louisville, Madison met classmate and founder of Mavizon technologies, Marc Ingram. After becoming deeply involved in the ideas Marc had been cultivating Madison was ready to take the project to the next level. A quick thinker and doer, Madison approached the owner of Samtec, Inc (a 480 million dollar, debt free company where Madison was employed) to seek financial backing.

Since securing an investment agreement with Samtec, Inc, Madison has played an integral role in transforming Mavizon from a two-person idea house to a legitimate 17-person company. He has directed the hardware design and development for Mavizonâ€™s flagship product, the Maviaâ„¢ connected car solution, led negotiations with Fortune 100 partners, recruited top technical talent, and served as the face of Mavizon Technologies for public relations and media requests.

Madison often accepts public speaking engagements for industry events, networking groups, and local universities to share insights on starting a business, give advice to young professionals, or show off some of the projects in development at Mavizon.
